definition: place/seat
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Transposons are one cause of genetic diseases such as haemophilia .
sentences.chinese: 转位子是产生如血友病一类遗传病的一个致病因子。

sentences.english: There are only so many seats.
He gave Powell secretary of state and then began to box him up.
sentences.chinese: 他给了鲍威尔国务卿的位子，然后开始捆住他的手脚。

sentences.english: Chris Hughton will be offered the opportunity to make a quick return to management with Sheffield United.
sentences.chinese: 谢非联为胡顿提供了一个快速上位的教练位子。

sentences.english: His prime ministership is looking more secure by the day.
sentences.chinese: 现在看来他的总理位子更稳了。

sentences.english: Rumour has it that he is positioning himself to take over from Mr Papandreou.
sentences.chinese: 有传言称这是因为他要取代潘帕德里欧的位子。

sentences.english: They entered the carriage once more, and the coachman mounted his box.
sentences.chinese: 他们又坐上马车，车夫坐到自己的位子上。

sentences.english: Astrologically, I observe that Saturn is in Leo.
sentences.chinese: 从占星学角度来说，我观察到土星的位子处于狮子座。

sentences.english: Oh, sorry. Where are our seats?
sentences.chinese: 唉呀，不好意思。我们的位子在哪啊？

sentences.english: Several researchers are already working on creating transposons lacking the capacity to make their own transposase.
sentences.chinese: 有些研究人员正在创造不能制造转位酵素的转位子。

sentences.english: Who would want to take a job that came with a serious risk of financial destruction?
sentences.chinese: 谁会愿意冒着如此之大的经济风险去坐这个位子？

sentences.english: Mr Zardari won an indirect ballot to replace him.
sentences.chinese: 扎尔达里通过赢得间接的选举从而取代了他的位子。

sentences.english: This is the pew that the Hatch’s sat on Sunday services.
sentences.chinese: 这就是哈奇每个星期天做礼拜的位子。

sentences.english: Webster is retiring as head of the Central Intelligence Agency ( CIA ).
sentences.chinese: 韦伯斯特即将从中央情报局局长的位子上退职。

sentences.english: I'd love to reserve a tcapable to Number 3.
sentences.chinese: 我想要预约3一自己的位子。

sentences.english: You can't travel first-class with a second-class ticket.
sentences.chinese: 你不可以拿二等票坐头等位子旅行。

definition: working hand/member of a work team/participant/(short form of 第一把手[di4 yi1 ba3 shou3]) the boss
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
deputy leader/the second-in-command
to sit down
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
throne
to take up duty as/to assume a position/to assume/to take on (an office)
one's immediate superior
to withdraw to the second line of duty/to resign from a leading post (and assume an advisory post)
old-style wooden folding armchair, typically featuring a footrest/(fig.) position in a hierarchy
post/position/job/duties
power/authority
to be promoted to
qualifications/experience/seniority
